clinical_study.brief_title: Ablation of Complex Fractionated Electrograms With or Without Additional Linear Lesions for Persistent Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Ablation of Complex Fractionated Electrograms With or Without Additional Linear Lesions for Persistent Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: While there is a consensus to perform pulmonary vein isolation (PVI) as a cornerstone for paroxysmal and persistent atrial fibrillation (AF), different additional ablation approaches are used for substrate modification: linear lesions, ablation of complex fractionated atrial electrograms (CFAE) or a combination of both. The aim of this study is to determine whether there is a difference in terms of freedom from arrhythmia recurrence between PVI with CFAE ablation in combination or not with linear lesions in patients with persistent AF.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Documented freedom from atrial arrhythmia (AF or AT) recurrence

secondary_outcome.description: Duration of procedure, ablation time, fluoroscopy time and complications

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and result of reablation procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of redo procedures, results and type of recurrent arrhythmia

arm_group.description: Intervention: Complex fractionated atrial electrograms (CFAE) Ablation
CFAE Ablation followed by linear lesions (anterior and Roof line)

intervention.description: pulmonary vein Isolation (PVI), CFAE for substrate modification and direct current cardioversion (DCC) if AF persists

intervention.intervention_name: PVI, CFAE, anterior and roof line, DCC
intervention.description: PVI, CFAE ablation. If AF persists linear lesions (anterior and roof line), cardioversion if AF persists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with symptomatic persistent AF
- After PVI +CFAE ablation, no termination into sinusrhythm or atrial tachycardia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Left atrial thrombus
